preamble.longtitle: An Act to amend the law relating to the registration of ships; to make provision for the giving of financial assistance in connection with the training of seamen and crew relief costs; to make provision for the establishment of a Merchant Navy Reserve; to make further provision with respect to the safety of shipping, with respect to liability and compensation for oil pollution and with respect to the financing and administration of the lighthouse service; to make other amendments of the law relating to shipping, seamen and pollution; and for connected purposes.
preamble.enactment: Be it enacted by the Queen's most Excellent Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, as follows

content.leaf: Registration of British Ships
Preliminary

leaf.margin: Effect of Part I and interpretation.

content.leaf: Effect of Part I and interpretation.In this Part—
Effect of Part I and interpretation.sections 2 and 3 have effect in place of section 1 of the [1894 c. 60.] Merchant Shipping Act 1894 (qualification for owning British ship); and

Effect of Part I and interpretation.sections 4 to 8 have effect in place of sections 2 and 3 of that Act (obligation to register British ships and exemptions from registry) and for otherwise regulating the registration of ships under Part I of that Act in the United Kingdom.
Effect of Part I and interpretation.In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires—
Effect of Part I and interpretation."length", in relation to a ship, has the same meaning as in the tonnage regulations of the 1894 Act;
Effect of Part I and interpretation."owner", in relation to a registered ship, means registered owner;
Effect of Part I and interpretation."registered" and "registration" mean respectively registered and registration under Part I of the 1894 Act in the United Kingdom;
Effect of Part I and interpretation."representative person" means a person appointed (or treated as appointed) as such under section 5.
Effect of Part I and interpretation.References in this Part to a ship being entitled to be registered shall be construed in accordance with section 4.

leaf.margin: British ships.

content.leaf: British ships.A ship shall be a British ship for the purposes of the Merchant Shipping Acts if—
British ships.the ship is registered in the United Kingdom under any of the following enactments, namely—
British ships.Part I of the 1894 Act or section 5 of the [1983 c. 13.] Merchant Shipping Act 1983 (registration of small ships), or
British ships.Part II of this Act (registration of British fishing vessels); or
British ships.the ship is registered in the United Kingdom in pursuance of an Order in Council under section 80 of the [1906 c. 48.] Merchant Shipping Act 1906 (Government ships); or
British ships.the ship is a fishing vessel within the meaning of Part II of this Act which is eligible to be registered under that Part of this Act by virtue of section 14 below, but—
British ships.is excluded from registration under that Part of this Act by regulations made under section 13 below, and
British ships.is not registered under the law of any country outside the United Kingdom; or
British ships.the ship is registered under the law of a relevant overseas territory; or
British ships.the ship is less than 24 metres in length and—
British ships.is not a fishing vessel within the meaning of Part II of this Act, and
British ships.is not registered in the United Kingdom under an enactment falling within paragraph (a)(i) above or under the law of any country outside the United Kingdom, but
British ships.is wholly owned by one or more persons qualified to be owners of British ships by virtue of section 3(1) below.

British ships.This section shall have effect in relation to any time before the end of the period referred to in section 13(3)(b) below as if the enactments falling within subsection (1)(a)(i) included Part IV of the 1894 Act (registration of British fishing boats).

leaf.margin: Persons qualified to be owners of British ships.

content.leaf: Persons qualified to be owners of British ships.For the purposes of Part I of the 1894 Act the following persons are persons qualified to be owners of British ships, namely—
Persons qualified to be owners of British ships.British citizens;
Persons qualified to be owners of British ships.British Dependent Territories citizens;
Persons qualified to be owners of British ships.British Overseas citizens;
Persons qualified to be owners of British ships.persons who under the [1981 c. 61.] British Nationality Act 1981 are British subjects;
Persons qualified to be owners of British ships.persons who under the [S.I. 1986/948.] Hong Kong (British Nationality) Order 1986 are British Nationals (Overseas);

Persons qualified to be owners of British ships.bodies corporate incorporated in the United Kingdom or in any relevant overseas territory and having their principal place of business in the United Kingdom or in any such territory; and
Persons qualified to be owners of British ships.citizens of the Republic of Ireland.

Persons qualified to be owners of British ships.Subject to subsection (3) below, references (however phrased) in any statutory provision to persons who are, for the purposes of Part I of the 1894 Act, qualified to be owners of British ships shall be construed in accordance with subsection (1) above.

Persons qualified to be owners of British ships.For the purposes of section 5 of the [1983 c. 13.] Merchant Shipping Act 1983 the following persons are persons qualified to be owners of British ships, namely—
Persons qualified to be owners of British ships.persons falling within paragraphs (a) to (e) and (g) of subsection (1) above; and
Persons qualified to be owners of British ships.Commonwealth citizens not falling within those paragraphs.

Persons qualified to be owners of British ships.It is hereby declared that a person who is not qualified under subsection (1) above to be an owner of a British ship may nevertheless be one of the owners of such a ship if—
Persons qualified to be owners of British ships.a majority interest in the ship (within the meaning of section 4 below) is owned by persons who are qualified to be owners of British ships; and
Persons qualified to be owners of British ships.the ship is registered, in accordance with the provisions of that section, under Part I of the 1894 Act.
Registration under Part I of 1894 Act

leaf.margin: Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.

content.leaf: Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.Subject to sections 6 and 7 below, this section has effect for the purpose of determining whether a ship is entitled to be registered under Part I of the 1894 Act in the United Kingdom.

Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.Subject to subsection (3), a ship shall be entitled to be registered if a majority interest in the ship is owned by one or more persons qualified to be owners of British ships by virtue of section 3(1)(a), (b), (e) or (f) above.
Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.Where—
Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.a ship falling within subsection (2) is 24 metres or more in length, and
Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.the person, or (as the case may be) each of the persons, by whom the majority interest in the ship is owned is not resident in the United Kingdom,
Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.the ship shall only be entitled to be registered if a representative person is appointed in relation to the ship.

Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.Where a majority interest in a ship is owned by one or more persons qualified to be owners of British ships by virtue of section 3(1)(c), (d) or (g) above, the ship shall be entitled to be registered—
Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.if that person, or (as the case may be) any of those persons, is resident in the United Kingdom, or

Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.(where that condition is not satisfied) if the Secretary of State furnishes him or them with a declaration that he consents to the ship being registered, and, in addition, a representative person is appointed in relation to the ship.
Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.Where a majority interest in a ship is owned by the following persons, namely—
Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.one or more persons qualified to be owners of British ships by virtue of section 3(1)(a), (b), (e) or (f), and
Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.one or more persons so qualified by virtue of section 3(1)(c), (d) or (g),
Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.the ship shall be entitled to be registered—
Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.if any of those persons is resident in the United Kingdom, or
Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.(where that condition is not satisfied) if a representative person is appointed in relation to the ship.
Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.A ship shall, in accordance with section 13(2)(a) below, not be entitled to be registered if it is a fishing vessel within the meaning of Part II.
Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.For the purposes of this section—

Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.one or more persons shall be treated as owning a majority interest in a ship if there is vested in that person or in those persons, taken together, the legal title to 33 or more of the 64 shares into which the property in the ship is divided, for the purposes of registration, in accordance with section 5 of the 1894 Act (there being left out of account for this purpose any share in which any beneficial interest is owned by a person who is not qualified to be an owner of a British ship); and

Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.a body corporate shall be treated as resident in the United Kingdom if it is incorporated in the United Kingdom and has its principal place of business there.
Entitlement to registration under Part I of 1894 Act.Nothing in this section applies to a ship to which section 80 of the [1906 c. 48.] Merchant Shipping Act 1906 applies (Government ships).

leaf.margin: Representative persons.

content.leaf: Representative persons.Where the entitlement of any ship to be registered is, by virtue of any provision of section 4, conditional on the appointment of a representative person in relation to the ship, the owner of the ship shall—

Representative persons.before applying for the ship to be registered, appoint an individual or body corporate satisfying the prescribed requirements to be the representative person in relation to the ship, and
Representative persons.secure that, so long as the ship remains registered, an individual or body corporate satisfying those requirements is so appointed.
Representative persons.For the purposes of subsection (1) the prescribed requirements are—
Representative persons.that the representative person is either—
Representative persons.an individual resident in the United Kingdom, or
Representative persons.a body corporate incorporated in the United Kingdom and having its principal place of business there; and
Representative persons.such other requirements as the Secretary of State may by regulations prescribe.

Representative persons.Where subsection (1) applies to a ship, any person who is registered under section 59(2) of the 1894 Act (registration of ship's manager) in relation to the ship shall, if that person is such an individual or body corporate as is mentioned in subsection (2)(a)(i) or (ii) above, be treated for the purposes of this Part of this Act as the representative person for the time being appointed in relation to the ship.
Representative persons.The owner of any ship in relation to which any representative person is for the time being appointed shall—
Representative persons.on applying for the ship to be registered, notify the registrar to whom the application is made of the name and address of the representative person; and

Representative persons.in the event of any change in the identity, or in the address, of the representative person so appointed, notify the registrar of the ship's port of registry of the name and address of the new representative person, or (as the case may be) of the new address, as soon as practicable after the change occurs;
Representative persons.and the registrar in question shall record any particulars notified to him in pursuance of this section in the register kept by him under Part I of the 1894 Act.

Representative persons.Any document required or authorised, by virtue of any statutory provision, to be served for the purpose of the institution of, or otherwise in connection with, proceedings for an offence under the Merchant Shipping Acts, or under any instrument in force under those Acts, shall, where the person to be served is the owner of a registered ship, be treated as duly served on him if—
Representative persons.delivered to any representative person for the time being appointed in relation to the ship, or
Representative persons.sent to any such person by post at the address notified (or, as the case may be, last notified) to the registrar under subsection (4) in relation to that person, or
Representative persons.left for any such person at that address.

Representative persons.Any person who contravenes subsection (1)(b) or (4)(b) above shall be guilty of an offence and liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding the third level on the standard scale.

leaf.margin: Refusal of registration.

content.leaf: Refusal of registration.If for any reason it appears to the Secretary of State that a ship in respect of which an application for registration has been made may not be entitled to be registered, he may by notice served on—
Refusal of registration.the applicant, or
Refusal of registration.any representative person for the time being appointed in relation to the ship,
Refusal of registration.require that person to furnish him with such information as he thinks necessary for the purpose of determining whether the ship is entitled to be registered.

Refusal of registration.Where the Secretary of State has served a notice under subsection (1) with respect to any ship, then, unless he has become satisfied that the ship is entitled to be registered, he shall, as soon as practicable after the end of the period of 30 days beginning with the date of service of that notice, give to registrars of British ships generally a direction requiring them not to register the ship.

Refusal of registration.Notwithstanding that any ship in respect of which an application for registration has been made is entitled to be registered, the Secretary of State may give to registrars of British ships generally a direction requiring them not to register the ship if he is satisfied that, having regard—
Refusal of registration.to the condition of the ship so far as relevant to its safety or to any risk of pollution, or
Refusal of registration.to the safety, health and welfare of persons employed or engaged in any capacity on board the ship,
Refusal of registration.it would be inappropriate for the ship to be registered.

leaf.margin: Power of Secretary of State to direct removal from the register.

content.leaf: Power of Secretary of State to direct removal from the register.If for any reason it appears to the Secretary of State that a registered ship may no longer be entitled to be registered, he may by notice served on—
Power of Secretary of State to direct removal from the register.the owner of the ship, or
Power of Secretary of State to direct removal from the register.any representative person for the time being appointed in relation to the ship,

Power of Secretary of State to direct removal from the register.require that person to furnish him with such information as he thinks necessary for the purpose of determining whether the ship is entitled to be registered.

Power of Secretary of State to direct removal from the register.Where the Secretary of State has served a notice under subsection (1) with respect to any ship, then, unless he has become satisfied that the ship is entitled to be registered, he shall, as soon as practicable after the end of the period of 30 days beginning with the date of service of that notice, serve a notice under subsection (4) on the owner or on any representative person for the time being appointed in relation to the ship.
Power of Secretary of State to direct removal from the register.Where the Secretary of State is satisfied—

Power of Secretary of State to direct removal from the register.that, having regard to the matters mentioned in paragraph (a) or (b) of section 6(3), it would be inappropriate for a registered ship to continue to be registered, or

Power of Secretary of State to direct removal from the register.that any penalty imposed on the owner of a registered ship in respect of a contravention of the Merchant Shipping Acts, or of any instrument in force under those Acts, has remained unpaid for a period of more than three months (and no appeal against the penalty is pending), or

Power of Secretary of State to direct removal from the register.that any summons for any such contravention has been duly served on the owner of a registered ship but the owner failed to appear at the time and place appointed for the trial of the information or complaint in question and a period of not less than three months has elapsed since that time,

Power of Secretary of State to direct removal from the register.the Secretary of State shall serve a notice under subsection (4) either on the owner or on any representative person for the time being appointed in relation to the ship.
Power of Secretary of State to direct removal from the register.A notice under this subsection is a notice stating—

Power of Secretary of State to direct removal from the register.that the Secretary of State is not satisfied that the ship in question is entitled to be registered or (as the case may be) that he is satisfied as mentioned in paragraph (a), (b) or (c) of subsection (3); and

Power of Secretary of State to direct removal from the register.that he intends, after the end of the period of 30 days beginning with the date of service of the notice, to direct that the ship in question should cease to be registered unless he is satisfied that it would be inappropriate to do so by any representations made to him by or on behalf of the owner within that period.

Power of Secretary of State to direct removal from the register.As soon as practicable after the end of that period the Secretary of State shall accordingly direct the registrar of the ship's port of registry to terminate the ship's registration unless he is satisfied that it would be inappropriate to do so by any such representations.

Power of Secretary of State to direct removal from the register.Where the registration of any ship has terminated by virtue of this section, the Secretary of State may subsequently, if he is satisfied that it would be appropriate to do so, direct the registrar of the ship's former port of registry to restore the ship's registration.

leaf.margin: Offences relating to furnishing of information, and duty to comply with directions.

content.leaf: Offences relating to furnishing of information, and duty to comply with directions.Any person who—
Offences relating to furnishing of information, and duty to comply with directions.in purported compliance with the requirements of a notice under section 6(1) or 7(1), or
Offences relating to furnishing of information, and duty to comply with directions.in connection with the making of any representations in pursuance of section 7(4)(b),

Offences relating to furnishing of information, and duty to comply with directions.knowingly or recklessly furnishes information which is false in a material particular shall be guilty of an offence and liable—
Offences relating to furnishing of information, and duty to comply with directions.on summary conviction, to a fine not exceeding the statutory maximum;
Offences relating to furnishing of information, and duty to comply with directions.on conviction on indictment, to a fine.

Offences relating to furnishing of information, and duty to comply with directions.It shall be the duty of any person to whom the Secretary of State gives a direction under this Part to give effect to that direction.

leaf.margin: Duty of owner of registered ship to secure termination of any overseas registration.

content.leaf: Duty of owner of registered ship to secure termination of any overseas registration.Where a ship becomes registered at a time when it is already registered under the law of any country outside the United Kingdom, the owner of the ship shall take all reasonable steps to secure the termination of the ship's registration under the law of that country.

Duty of owner of registered ship to secure termination of any overseas registration.Any person who contravenes subsection (1) shall be guilty of an offence and liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding the third level on the standard scale.

Duty of owner of registered ship to secure termination of any overseas registration.Subsection (1) does not apply to a ship which becomes registered in pursuance of section 53B of the 1894 Act (transfer of registration under that Act from overseas territory).

leaf.margin: Amendments of Part I of 1894 Act.

content.leaf: Amendments of Part I of 1894 Act.Part I of the 1894 Act shall have effect subject to the amendments specified in Schedule 1 to this Act, which include amendments—
Amendments of Part I of 1894 Act.restricting the scope of operation of that Part of that Act to registration in the United Kingdom;
Amendments of Part I of 1894 Act.restricting the grant of provisional certificates of registration under section 22 of that Act (ships becoming British-owned abroad); and
Amendments of Part I of 1894 Act.enabling ships to be registered otherwise than in register books;
Amendments of Part I of 1894 Act.as well as amendments consequential on the preceding provisions of this Part of this Act.
Amendments of Part I of 1894 Act.In Part I of the 1894 Act—

Amendments of Part I of 1894 Act.references to registration or to registered ships or registered owners shall accordingly (unless the context otherwise requires) be construed as references to registration, or to ships or owners registered, under that Part of that Act in the United Kingdom;
Amendments of Part I of 1894 Act.references to registrars of British ships shall accordingly be construed as references to registrars of British ships in the United Kingdom;
Amendments of Part I of 1894 Act.references to a ship being entitled to be registered shall be construed in accordance with section 4 of this Act; and
Amendments of Part I of 1894 Act.references to the ownership of a majority interest in a ship shall be construed in accordance with subsection (7)(a) of that section.
Registration in overseas territories

leaf.margin: Regulation of registration in overseas territories by reference to categories of registries.

content.leaf: Regulation of registration in overseas territories by reference to categories of registries.Her Majesty may by Order in Council make provision for regulating the registration of ships under Part I of the 1894 Act in relevant overseas territories by reference to categories of registries established by the Order.
Regulation of registration in overseas territories by reference to categories of registries.Any such Order may—

Regulation of registration in overseas territories by reference to categories of registries.establish different categories of registries to which different restrictions on the registration of ships under Part I of the 1894 Act apply, being restrictions framed by reference to—
Regulation of registration in overseas territories by reference to categories of registries.ships' tonnages, or
Regulation of registration in overseas territories by reference to categories of registries.types of ships, or
Regulation of registration in overseas territories by reference to categories of registries.any other specified matter, or
Regulation of registration in overseas territories by reference to categories of registries.any combination of matters falling within one or more of the preceding sub-paragraphs,
Regulation of registration in overseas territories by reference to categories of registries.as well as a category of registries to which no such restriction applies;

Regulation of registration in overseas territories by reference to categories of registries.assign any relevant overseas territory to such one of the categories so established as appears to Her Majesty to be appropriate;

Regulation of registration in overseas territories by reference to categories of registries.provide that, where a relevant overseas territory has been assigned to a category to which any such restriction on registration as is mentioned in paragraph (a) applies, no ship covered by that restriction shall be registered under Part I of the 1894 Act in that territory;
Regulation of registration in overseas territories by reference to categories of registries.specify circumstances in which ships may be exempted from any provision made by virtue of paragraph (c).

Regulation of registration in overseas territories by reference to categories of registries.Any provision made by virtue of subsection (2)(c) shall be expressed to be without prejudice to the operation of any provision for the time being in force under the law of any such territory as is mentioned in subsection (2)(c) by virtue of which the registration of ships under Part I of the 1894 Act in that territory is, or may be, further restricted.
Regulation of registration in overseas territories by reference to categories of registries.An Order in Council under this section—

Regulation of registration in overseas territories by reference to categories of registries.may make such transitional, incidental or supplementary provision as appears to Her Majesty to be necessary or expedient; and
Regulation of registration in overseas territories by reference to categories of registries.shall be subject to annulment in pursuance of a resolution of either House of Parliament.
Registration of British Fishing Vessels
Preliminary

leaf.margin: Interpretation of Part II, etc.

content.leaf: Interpretation of Part II, etc.In this Part (unless the context otherwise requires)—

Interpretation of Part II, etc."fishing vessel" means a vessel for the time being used (or, in the context of an application for registration, intended to be used) for or in connection with fishing for sea fish, other than a vessel used (or intended to be used) for fishing otherwise than for profit;
Interpretation of Part II, etc."fishing vessel survey rules" has the meaning given by section 2 of the [

Interpretation of Part II, etc.1970 c. 27.] Fishing Vessels (Safety Provisions) Act 1970, and any reference to a survey under the fishing vessel survey rules is a reference to such a survey carried out in the United Kingdom;
Interpretation of Part II, etc."owner", in relation to a registered fishing vessel, means registered owner;
Interpretation of Part II, etc."prescribed" means prescribed by regulations under section 13;
Interpretation of Part II, etc."the register" means the register of British fishing vessels referred to in section 13(1)(a);
Interpretation of Part II, etc."registered" and "registration" mean respectively registered and registration in the register;
Interpretation of Part II, etc."sea fish" includes shellfish, salmon and migratory trout (as defined by section 44 of the [
Interpretation of Part II, etc.1981 c. 29.] Fisheries Act 1981);

Interpretation of Part II, etc."share", in relation to a fishing vessel, means one of the shares into which the property in the vessel is divided, for the purposes of registration, in accordance with section 18.

Interpretation of Part II, etc.It is hereby declared that a vessel for the time being used (or intended to be used) wholly for the purpose of conveying persons wishing to fish for pleasure is not a fishing vessel for the purposes of this Part.
Interpretation of Part II, etc.References in this Part to a fishing vessel being eligible to be registered as a British fishing vessel shall be construed in accordance with section 14.

Interpretation of Part II, etc.For the purposes of this Part the beneficial ownership of a fishing vessel shall be determined by reference to every beneficial interest in that vessel, however arising (whether held by a trustee or nominee or arising under a contract or otherwise), other than an interest held by any person as mortgagee.
New system of registration for fishing vessels

leaf.margin: Separate registration of fishing vessels.

content.leaf: Separate registration of fishing vessels.The Secretary of State shall by regulations make provision—
Separate registration of fishing vessels.for the establishment and maintenance of a register of British fishing vessels; and
Separate registration of fishing vessels.for the registration in that register of fishing vessels which are, by virtue of section 14, eligible to be registered as British fishing vessels.
Separate registration of fishing vessels.Subject to subsection (3), a fishing vessel shall no longer be capable of being registered under any of the following enactments, namely—
Separate registration of fishing vessels.Part I of the 1894 Act;
Separate registration of fishing vessels.section 373 of that Act (registry of British fishing boats); or
Separate registration of fishing vessels.the [1886 c. 53.] Sea Fishing Boats (Scotland) Act 1886.

Separate registration of fishing vessels.Where any fishing vessel is registered under any of those enactments immediately before the commencement of this Part, the registration of the vessel under that enactment shall (notwithstanding any repeals made by this Act) continue in force until—
Separate registration of fishing vessels.the vessel (being eligible to be registered as a British fishing vessel) is registered under this Part in accordance with regulations under this section, or
Separate registration of fishing vessels.the end of such period beginning with the commencement of this Part as may be prescribed,
Separate registration of fishing vessels.whichever first occurs.

Separate registration of fishing vessels.Any fishing vessel whose registration under any of those enactments continues in force by virtue of subsection (3) shall be deemed to be a vessel registered under this Part for the purposes of sections 19, 20 and 22 below.

Separate registration of fishing vessels.Where a fishing vessel becomes registered under this Part at a time when it is already registered under the law of any country outside the United Kingdom, the owner of the vessel shall take all reasonable steps to secure the termination of the vessel's registration under the law of that country.

Separate registration of fishing vessels.Any person who contravenes subsection (5) shall be guilty of an offence and liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding the third level on the standard scale.
Separate registration of fishing vessels.Schedule 2 shall have effect for the purpose of supplementing this section.

leaf.margin: Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.

content.leaf: Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.Subject to subsections (3) and (4), a fishing vessel shall only be eligible to be registered as a British fishing vessel if—
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.the vessel is British-owned;
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.the vessel is managed, and its operations are directed and controlled, from within the United Kingdom; and
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.any charterer, manager or operator of the vessel is a qualified person or company.
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.For the purposes of subsection (1)(a) a fishing vessel is British-owned if—
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.the legal title to the vessel is vested wholly in one or more qualified persons or companies; and
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.the vessel is beneficially owned—
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.as to not less than the relevant percentage of the property in the vessel, by one or more qualified persons, or
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.wholly by a qualified company or companies, or

Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.by one or more qualified companies and, as to not less than the relevant percentage of the remainder of the property in the vessel, by one or more qualified persons.

Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.The Secretary of State may by regulations specify further requirements which must be satisfied in order for a fishing vessel to be eligible to be registered as a British fishing vessel, being requirements imposed—
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.in connection with the implementation of any of the requirements specified in subsection (1)(a) to (c), or
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.in addition to the requirements so specified,

Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.and appearing to the Secretary of State to be appropriate for securing that such a vessel has a genuine and substantial connection with the United Kingdom.
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.Where, in the case of any fishing vessel, the Secretary of State is satisfied that—

Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.the vessel would be eligible to be registered as a British fishing vessel but for the fact that any particular individual, or (as the case may be) each of a number of particular individuals, is not a British citizen (and is accordingly not a qualified person), and

Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.it would be appropriate to dispense with the requirement of British citizenship in the case of that individual or those individuals, in view of the length of time he has or they have resided in the United Kingdom and been involved in the fishing industry of the United Kingdom,

Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.the Secretary of State may determine that that requirement should be so dispensed with; and, if he does so, the vessel shall, so long as paragraph (a) above applies to it and any such determination remains in force, be treated for the purposes of this Part as eligible to be registered as a British fishing vessel.

Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.Where any share in a vessel is beneficially owned jointly by persons not all of whom are qualified persons or companies, then, for the purposes of this section, the whole of that share shall be treated as beneficially owned by persons who are not qualified persons or companies.

Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.For the purpose of determining whether a fishing vessel is eligible to be registered as a British fishing vessel, the Secretary of State may, if he thinks fit, appoint a person—
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.to investigate the eligibility of the vessel to be so registered, and
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.to make a report of his conclusions to the Secretary of State;

Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.and any person so appointed shall, for the purpose of conducting the investigation, have the powers conferred on an inspector by the provisions of section 27 of the [1979 c. 39.] Merchant Shipping Act 1979 (other than paragraphs (d) to (h) of subsection (1) of that section).
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.In this section—
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel."qualified company" means a company which satisfies the following conditions, namely—
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.it is incorporated in the United Kingdom and has its principal place of business there;

Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.at least the relevant percentage of its shares (taken as a whole), and of each class of its shares, is legally and beneficially owned by one or more qualified persons or companies; and
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.at least the relevant percentage of its directors are qualified persons;
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel."qualified person" means—
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.a person who is a British citizen resident and domiciled in the United Kingdom, or
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel.a local authority in the United Kingdom; and
Eligibility for registration as British fishing vessel."the relevant percentage" means 75 per cent. or such greater percentage (which may be 100 per cent.) as may for the time being be prescribed.

leaf.margin: Grant or refusal of applications for registration of fishing vessels.

content.leaf: Grant or refusal of applications for registration of fishing vessels.If, on an application for the registration of a fishing vessel made in accordance with regulations under section 13, the Secretary of State is satisfied—
Grant or refusal of applications for registration of fishing vessels.that the vessel is eligible to be registered as a British fishing vessel, and
Grant or refusal of applications for registration of fishing vessels.that any relevant requirements of any such regulations have been complied with in relation to the vessel,
Grant or refusal of applications for registration of fishing vessels.he shall (subject to subsection (2)) cause the vessel to be registered as a British fishing vessel.

Grant or refusal of applications for registration of fishing vessels.Notwithstanding that the Secretary of State is so satisfied, he may refuse any such application if he is satisfied that there is not in force in respect of the vessel any certificate required to be so in force by virtue of section 4 of the [1970 c. 27.] Fishing Vessels (Safety Provisions) Act 1970 (prohibition on going to sea without appropriate certificates).

Grant or refusal of applications for registration of fishing vessels.If, on any such application, the Secretary of State is not satisfied as mentioned in subsection (1), he shall refuse the application.

leaf.margin: Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.

content.leaf: Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.If for any reason it appears to the Secretary of State that a registered vessel may no longer be eligible to be registered as a British fishing vessel, he may by notice served on—
Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.the owner of the vessel, or
Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.any charterer, manager or operator of the vessel,
Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.require that person, at such time or times as may be specified in the notice—

Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.to produce to the Secretary of State such documents or descriptions of documents specified in the notice, and

Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.to furnish to him, in such form as may be specified in the notice, such accounts, estimates, returns or other information (of whatever nature) specified in the notice,

Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.as the Secretary of State thinks necessary for the purpose of determining whether the vessel is eligible to be so registered.

Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.In a case where the owner of a registered vessel is a company, subsection (1) shall apply to any person holding any shares in the company as it applies to the company.

Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.Where the Secretary of State has served a notice under subsection (1) with respect to any vessel, then, unless he has become satisfied that the vessel is eligible to be registered as a British fishing vessel—

Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.he shall, as soon as practicable after the end of the period of 30 days beginning with the date of service of that notice, serve a notice under subsection (6) on the owner of the vessel, and
Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.the vessel's registration shall terminate by virtue of this subsection at the relevant time.

Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.Where it appears to the Secretary of State that there is not in force in respect of any registered vessel any such certificate as is mentioned in section 15(2), he may by notice served on the owner of the vessel require the vessel to be presented for a survey under the fishing vessel survey rules within the period of 30 days beginning with the date of service of the notice.
Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.If the vessel is not presented for such a survey within that period—
Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.the Secretary of State shall serve a notice under subsection (6) on the owner of the vessel, and
Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.the vessel's registration shall terminate by virtue of this subsection at the relevant time.
Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.A notice under this subsection is a notice stating—

Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.that the Secretary of State is not satisfied that the vessel in question is eligible to be registered as a British fishing vessel, or
Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.that the vessel has not been presented for a survey as required by a notice under subsection (4),

Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.as the case may be, and that the vessel's registration will accordingly terminate at the relevant time by virtue of subsection (3) or (5).

Termination of registration where vessel is not eligible for registration or is not certificated.In this section "the relevant time" , in relation to a notice under subsection (6), means the end of the period of 14 days beginning with the date of service of that notice.

leaf.margin: Consequences of termination of registration by virtue of s.16.

content.leaf: Consequences of termination of registration by virtue of s.16.Where the registration of any vessel has terminated by virtue of section 16(3) or (5), then, without prejudice to the operation of any other provision of this Part of this Act or of regulations under section 13, the vessel shall not again be registered as a British fishing vessel unless—

Consequences of termination of registration by virtue of s.16.the Secretary of State is satisfied that the earlier failure of the vessel to be eligible to be so registered or (as the case may be) to be presented for a survey was due to inadvertence, and (in the latter case) that the vessel has since been presented for a survey, or
Consequences of termination of registration by virtue of s.16.the Secretary of State consents to the vessel being so registered, or

Consequences of termination of registration by virtue of s.16.in the case of a vessel whose registration terminated by virtue of section 16(3), the Secretary of State is satisfied that the vessel has been disposed of by its former registered owner by means of a transaction at arm's length and that no person who for the time being is a relevant owner of the vessel was a relevant owner of it at the time when its registration terminated.
Consequences of termination of registration by virtue of s.16.In subsection (1)(a) "survey" means a survey under the fishing vessel survey rules.
Consequences of termination of registration by virtue of s.16.For the purposes of subsection (1)(c) a person is a relevant owner of a vessel at any time if at that time—
Consequences of termination of registration by virtue of s.16.the legal title to the vessel or any share in it is vested in that person, or
Consequences of termination of registration by virtue of s.16.the vessel or any share in it is beneficially owned by that person, or
Consequences of termination of registration by virtue of s.16.any shares in a company falling within paragraph (a) or (b) above are legally or beneficially owned by that person,
Consequences of termination of registration by virtue of s.16.whether vested in, or (as the case may be) owned by, that person alone or together with any other person or persons.

leaf.margin: Registration of property in fishing vessels.

content.leaf: Registration of property in fishing vessels.For the purposes of the registration of a fishing vessel—
Registration of property in fishing vessels.the property in the vessel shall be divided into 64 shares;
Registration of property in fishing vessels.except as provided by paragraph (c), the number of persons registered as owners of the vessel shall not at any time exceed 64;

Registration of property in fishing vessels.any number of persons not exceeding five may be registered as joint owners of the vessel or of any share in the vessel (but for the purposes of paragraph (b) the registered joint owners of any such share shall be treated as constituting one person);

Registration of property in fishing vessels.a registered joint owner of the vessel or of any share in the vessel shall not be entitled to dispose of his interest in the vessel or share separately from the interest or interests in it of the other joint owner or joint owners; and
Registration of property in fishing vessels.a person shall not be entitled to be registered as the owner of a fractional part of a share in the vessel.

Registration of property in fishing vessels.Subsection (1)(b) and (c) do not prejudice any beneficial interest of any person represented by or claiming under or through a registered owner (including a registered joint owner).
Transfers etc. of registered vessels

leaf.margin: Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.

content.leaf: Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.Any transfer of—
Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.a registered vessel (not being a vessel registered in pursuance of paragraph 2(c) of Schedule 2), or
Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.a share in any such vessel,

Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.shall be effected by a bill of sale satisfying the requirements specified in subsection (2), unless the transfer will result in the vessel ceasing to be British-owned for the purposes of section 14(1)(a).
Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.Those requirements are that the bill of sale—
Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.is in such form as may be prescribed or approved by the Secretary of State; and
Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.contains a description of the vessel sufficient to identify the vessel to the satisfaction of the Secretary of State.

Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.Where any such vessel or share has been transferred in accordance with subsection (1), the transferee shall not be registered as owner of the vessel or share unless—

Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.he has made an application for the purpose in accordance with regulations under section 13 and has produced to the Secretary of State the bill of sale by which the vessel or share has been so transferred, and
Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.the Secretary of State is satisfied as mentioned in section 15(1);

Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.and section 15(2) and (3) shall apply in relation to an application under this subsection as they apply in relation to an application for the registration of a fishing vessel.
Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.If an application under subsection (3) is granted by the Secretary of State, the Secretary of State shall—

Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.register the bill of sale referred to in paragraph (a) of that subsection by causing the applicant's name to be entered in the register as owner of the vessel or share in question, and
Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.endorse on the bill of sale the fact that that entry has been made, together with the date and time when it was made.
Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.Bills of sale shall be registered under subsection (4) in the order in which they are produced to the Secretary of State for the purposes of registration.

Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.If on an application under subsection (3) the Secretary of State is not satisfied that the vessel with respect to which the application is made is eligible to be registered as a British fishing vessel—
Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.the Secretary of State shall serve a notice under subsection (7) on the owner of the vessel; and

Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.the vessel's registration shall terminate by virtue of this subsection at the end of the period of 14 days beginning with the date of service of that notice.
Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.A notice under this subsection is a notice stating—
Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.that the Secretary of State is not satisfied that the vessel in question is eligible to be registered as a British fishing vessel; and
Transfer of vessel or share by bill of sale.that the vessel's registration will accordingly terminate by virtue of subsection (6) at the end of the period referred to in that subsection.

leaf.margin: Transmission of property in vessel or share other than under s.19.

content.leaf: Transmission of property in vessel or share other than under s.19.Where a registered vessel, or a share in a registered vessel, is transmitted to any person by any lawful means other than by a transfer under section 19, that person shall not be registered as owner of the vessel or share unless—

Transmission of property in vessel or share other than under s.19.he has made an application for the purpose in accordance with regulations under section 13 and has produced to the Secretary of State such evidence of the transmission as may be prescribed; and
Transmission of property in vessel or share other than under s.19.the Secretary of State is satisfied as mentioned in section 15(1);

Transmission of property in vessel or share other than under s.19.and section 15(2) and (3) shall apply in relation to an application under this subsection as they apply in relation to an application for the registration of a fishing vessel.

Transmission of property in vessel or share other than under s.19.If an application under subsection (1) is granted by the Secretary of State, he shall cause the applicant's name to be entered in the register as owner of the vessel or share.

Transmission of property in vessel or share other than under s.19.The preceding provisions of this section shall apply in relation to the transmission of the interest of a joint owner in a registered vessel or in a share in any such vessel as they apply in relation to the transmission of any such vessel or share, except that anything required to be done by virtue of subsection (1)(a) shall be done by both or all of the joint owners of the vessel or share.

Transmission of property in vessel or share other than under s.19.If on an application under subsection (1) the Secretary of State is not satisfied that the vessel with respect to which the application is made is eligible to be registered as a British fishing vessel—
Transmission of property in vessel or share other than under s.19.the Secretary of State shall serve a notice under subsection (5) on the owner of the vessel; and

Transmission of property in vessel or share other than under s.19.the vessel's registration shall terminate by virtue of this subsection at the end of the period of 14 days beginning with the date of service of that notice.
Transmission of property in vessel or share other than under s.19.A notice under this subsection is a notice stating—

Transmission of property in vessel or share other than under s.19.that the Secretary of State is not satisfied that the vessel in question is eligible to be registered as a British fishing vessel; and

Transmission of property in vessel or share other than under s.19.that the vessel's registration will accordingly terminate by virtue of subsection (4) at the end of the period referred to in that subsection.
Mortgages of registered vessels

leaf.margin: Mortgages of registered vessels.

content.leaf: Mortgages of registered vessels.Schedule 3 to this Act (which makes provision with respect to the registration of mortgages) shall have effect.

Mortgages of registered vessels.Where the registration of any fishing vessel terminates by virtue of any provision of this Act, the termination of that registration shall not affect any entry made in the register under Schedule 3 so far as relating to any undischarged registered mortgage of that vessel or of any share in it.
Mortgages of registered vessels.In subsection (2) "registered mortgage" has the same meaning as in Schedule 3.
Unregistered fishing vessels

leaf.margin: Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.

content.leaf: Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.If any fishing vessel to which this subsection applies fishes for profit—
Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.the skipper, the owner and any charterer of the vessel shall each be guilty of an offence; and
Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.the vessel shall be liable to forfeiture.
Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.Subsection (1) applies to any fishing vessel which is either—
Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.eligible to be registered under this Part, or
Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.wholly owned by one or more persons qualified to be owners of British ships for the purposes of Part I of the 1894 Act,

Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.but is neither registered under this Part nor excluded from registration by regulations under section 13 nor registered under the law of any country outside the United Kingdom.

Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.Subsection (1) also applies to any fishing vessel which (notwithstanding that it is not entitled to be so registered) is for the time being registered in the United Kingdom under Part I of the 1894 Act or section 5 of the [1983 c. 13.] Merchant Shipping Act 1983 (registration of small ships).

Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.Subject to subsection (8), if any prescribed marks are displayed on a fishing vessel which is not a registered vessel, the skipper, the owner and any charterer of the vessel shall each be guilty of an offence.

Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.If the skipper or owner of a fishing vessel which is not a registered vessel does anything, or permits anything to be done, for the purpose of causing the vessel to appear to be a registered vessel, then (subject to subsection (8))—
Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.the skipper, the owner and any charterer of the vessel shall each be guilty of an offence; and
Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.the vessel shall be liable to forfeiture.
Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.Where a fishing vessel is not a British ship and is not registered under the law of any country outside the United Kingdom, but—
Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.it is eligible to be registered under this Part, or
Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.it is wholly owned by one or more such persons as are mentioned in subsection (2)(b), or
Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.(subject to subsection (8)) any prescribed marks are displayed on it,

Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.then (notwithstanding that the vessel is not entitled to any benefits, privileges, advantages or protection usually enjoyed by a British ship) the vessel shall, for the purposes mentioned in subsection (7), be dealt with in the same manner in all respects as if the vessel were a British ship.
Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.Those purposes are—
Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.the payment of dues, fees or other charges;
Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.liability to fines and forfeiture; and
Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.the punishment of offences committed on board the vessel, or by any persons belonging to it.

Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.Where the registration of any vessel has terminated by virtue of any provision of this Part, any prescribed marks displayed on the vessel within the period of 14 days beginning with the date of termination of that registration shall be disregarded for the purposes of subsections (4) to (6).
Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.Subsections (1), (4) and (5)(a) apply to offences falling within those provisions wherever committed.

Offences relating to, and liabilities of, unregistered fishing vessels.Section 76 of the 1894 Act (proceedings on forfeiture of ship) shall apply to any vessel liable to forfeiture under this section as it applies to any such ship as is mentioned in subsection (1) of that section.
Supplemental

leaf.margin: Notification of changes in ownership etc., and offences relating to furnishing of information.

content.leaf: Notification of changes in ownership etc., and offences relating to furnishing of information.If at any time there occurs, in relation to a registered vessel—
Notification of changes in ownership etc., and offences relating to furnishing of information.any change affecting the eligibility of the vessel to be registered as a British fishing vessel, or

Notification of changes in ownership etc., and offences relating to furnishing of information.any change (not falling within paragraph (a)) in the percentage of the property in the vessel which is beneficially owned by persons who are qualified persons or companies within the meaning of section 14,

Notification of changes in ownership etc., and offences relating to furnishing of information.the owner of the vessel shall, as soon as practicable after the change occurs, notify the Secretary of State in writing of that change.
Notification of changes in ownership etc., and offences relating to furnishing of information.Any person who contravenes subsection (1) shall be guilty of an offence.
Notification of changes in ownership etc., and offences relating to furnishing of information.Any person who—

Notification of changes in ownership etc., and offences relating to furnishing of information.in connection with the registration of any vessel or the making of any other entry in the register in pursuance of this Part, or
Notification of changes in ownership etc., and offences relating to furnishing of information.in purported compliance with the requirements of any notice under section 16(1),

Notification of changes in ownership etc., and offences relating to furnishing of information.knowingly or recklessly furnishes information which is false in a material particular shall be guilty of an offence.

Notification of changes in ownership etc., and offences relating to furnishing of information.Any person who intentionally alters, suppresses, conceals or destroys a document which he has been required to produce by a notice under section 16(1) shall be guilty of an offence.

leaf.margin: Penalties for offences under s. 22 or 23 and other provisions relating to such offences.

content.leaf: Penalties for offences under s. 22 or 23 and other provisions relating to such offences.Any person guilty of an offence under section 22 or 23 shall be liable—
Penalties for offences under s. 22 or 23 and other provisions relating to such offences.on summary conviction, to a fine not exceeding £50,000;
Penalties for offences under s. 22 or 23 and other provisions relating to such offences.on conviction on indictment, to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years or a fine, or both.
Penalties for offences under s. 22 or 23 and other provisions relating to such offences.Proceedings for an offence under section 22 or 23 shall not be instituted—

Penalties for offences under s. 22 or 23 and other provisions relating to such offences.in England and Wales, except by or with the consent of the Attorney General, the Secretary of State or the Minister; or

Penalties for offences under s. 22 or 23 and other provisions relating to such offences.in Northern Ireland, except by or with the consent of the Attorney General for Northern Ireland, the Secretary of State or the Minister.

Penalties for offences under s. 22 or 23 and other provisions relating to such offences.Proceedings for an offence under section 22 may be taken, and the offence may for all incidental purposes be treated as having been committed, in any place in the United Kingdom.
Penalties for offences under s. 22 or 23 and other provisions relating to such offences.In this section "the Minister"—
Penalties for offences under s. 22 or 23 and other provisions relating to such offences.in relation to England and Wales, means the Minister of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food; and
Penalties for offences under s. 22 or 23 and other provisions relating to such offences.in relation to Northern Ireland, means the Secretary of State concerned with sea fishing in Northern Ireland.

leaf.margin: Application of other enactments, etc.

content.leaf: Application of other enactments, etc.Any reference (however phrased) in any statutory provision not contained in this Act to the registration of a fishing vessel under any of the enactments specified in section 13(2) shall, so far as the context permits, be construed as, or as including, a reference to the registration of a fishing vessel under this Part; and connected phrases shall be construed accordingly.
Application of other enactments, etc.The following provisions of the 1894 Act, namely—
Application of other enactments, etc.section 69 (penalty for unduly assuming British character), and
Application of other enactments, etc.section 71 (penalty for acquiring ownership if unqualified),

Application of other enactments, etc.shall not apply to a registered vessel; and section 72 of that Act (liabilities of unregistered ships) shall not apply to a fishing vessel (whether registered or not).

Application of other enactments, etc.Sections 8 and 9 of the [1968 c. 77.] Sea Fisheries Act 1968 (general powers of British sea-fishery officers and powers of sea-fishery officers to enforce conventions) shall apply in relation to—
Application of other enactments, etc.this Part of this Act, and
Application of other enactments, etc.any regulations made under it,

Application of other enactments, etc.as they apply in relation to any order mentioned in section 8 of that Act and in relation to any convention mentioned in section 9 of that Act respectively; and sections 10 to 12 and 14 of that Act (offences and supplemental provisions as to legal proceedings) shall apply accordingly.

Application of other enactments, etc.A document purporting to be a copy of any information contained in an entry in the register and to be certified as a true copy by an authorised officer of the Secretary of State shall be evidence (and, in Scotland, sufficient evidence) of the matters stated in the document.
Miscellaneous Provisions relating to Merchant Shipping etc.
Financial assistance

leaf.margin: Financial assistance in respect of costs of training merchant navy officers and ratings.

content.leaf: Financial assistance in respect of costs of training merchant navy officers and ratings.The Secretary of State may, with the consent of the Treasury, give any person or body of persons of any description determined by him for the purposes of this section financial assistance in respect of expenses incurred or to be incurred by any such person or body in connection with the training (whether in the United Kingdom or elsewhere) of officers and ratings for service in merchant ships, including expenses incurred or to be incurred by any such person in connection with his undergoing any such training.

Financial assistance in respect of costs of training merchant navy officers and ratings.Assistance under this section may be given by way of a grant or a loan or otherwise; and in giving any such assistance the Secretary of State may impose such conditions as he thinks fit, including conditions requiring a grant to be repaid in specified circumstances.

Financial assistance in respect of costs of training merchant navy officers and ratings.This section is without prejudice to any other power of the Secretary of State to give financial assistance in connection with any such training as is mentioned in subsection (1).

leaf.margin: Financial assistance in respect of crew relief costs.

content.leaf: Financial assistance in respect of crew relief costs.The Secretary of State may, with the consent of the Treasury, give financial assistance to—
Financial assistance in respect of crew relief costs.the owner of a ship registered in the British Islands, or

Financial assistance in respect of crew relief costs.any manager of a ship so registered, being either an individual ordinarily resident in the British Islands or a body corporate which is incorporated in the British Islands and has its principal place of business there,

Financial assistance in respect of crew relief costs.in respect of travel and other costs incurred by the owner or manager in connection with members of the ship's crew joining or leaving the ship outside the Limited European trading area.

Financial assistance in respect of crew relief costs.If the Secretary of State so determines, eligibility for assistance under this section shall be conditional on the fulfilment of such conditions with respect to all or any of the following matters as are specified in his determination, namely —
Financial assistance in respect of crew relief costs.the nationality of any person in relation to whom any such costs as are mentioned in subsection (1) are incurred;
Financial assistance in respect of crew relief costs.the ordinary residence of any such person;
Financial assistance in respect of crew relief costs.the place (outside the Limited European trading area) where any such person joins or leaves his ship.

Financial assistance in respect of crew relief costs.Assistance under this section may be given by way of a grant or a loan or otherwise; and in giving any such assistance the Secretary of State may impose such conditions as he thinks fit.
Financial assistance in respect of crew relief costs.For the purposes of this section—
Financial assistance in respect of crew relief costs.the crew of a ship shall be taken to include the master and other officers of the ship; and

Financial assistance in respect of crew relief costs."the Limited European trading area" has the same meaning as it has for the purposes of any regulations made under section 43 of the [1970 c. 36.] Merchant Shipping Act 1970 (regulations about manning).
The Merchant Navy Reserve

leaf.margin: Establishment of the Merchant Navy Reserve.

content.leaf: Establishment of the Merchant Navy Reserve.The Secretary of State may establish and maintain a body of persons to be known as the Merchant Navy Reserve whose members may, in such circumstances and for such periods as the Secretary of State may determine, be required by him to serve in ships belonging to or employed in the service of Her Majesty.

Establishment of the Merchant Navy Reserve.The Merchant Navy Reserve shall consist of such number of persons as the Secretary of State may determine who voluntarily undertake to become members of the Reserve and are accepted as members of it.

Establishment of the Merchant Navy Reserve.The Secretary of State may determine the procedure by which, and the conditions under which, persons may become, or (subject to any regulations made by him under this section) may cease to be, members of the Merchant Navy Reserve.

Establishment of the Merchant Navy Reserve.The Secretary of State may make regulations with respect to the calling into, and discharge from, service of members of the Merchant Navy Reserve and with respect to other matters relating to the service of members of the Reserve.
Establishment of the Merchant Navy Reserve.Any such regulations may, in particular, make provision—
Establishment of the Merchant Navy Reserve.for call-out notices to be served on members of the Reserve;
Establishment of the Merchant Navy Reserve.for the requirements to be complied with by persons on whom such notices have been served;
Establishment of the Merchant Navy Reserve.as to the uniform and equipment with which members of the Reserve are to be provided;

Establishment of the Merchant Navy Reserve.for regulating the conduct and discipline of members of the Reserve who have entered into service, and for securing their attendance at their places of duty;

Establishment of the Merchant Navy Reserve.for the imposition of fines, or the forfeiture of pay or other amounts, for misconduct or breaches of discipline or for contraventions of provisions of the regulations.

Establishment of the Merchant Navy Reserve.Without prejudice to the operation of subsection (5)(e), regulations under this section may provide that a contravention of the regulations shall be an offence punishable on summary conviction by a fine not exceeding the third level on the standard scale or such lower amount as is prescribed by the regulations.

leaf.margin: Supplementary provisions relating to Merchant Navy Reserve.

content.leaf: Supplementary provisions relating to Merchant Navy Reserve.Subject to such conditions as the Secretary of State may determine, there shall be payable to members of the Merchant Navy Reserve such pay, bounties and allowances as he may determine.

Supplementary provisions relating to Merchant Navy Reserve.The Secretary of State may make such payments as he thinks fit in connection with the training and certification of members of the Merchant Navy Reserve (including payments to persons undergoing such training and payments in connection with the re-validation of certificates).

Supplementary provisions relating to Merchant Navy Reserve.The Secretary of State shall not make any determination under subsection (1), or any payment under subsection (2), except with the consent of the Treasury.
Supplementary provisions relating to Merchant Navy Reserve.Where any person is called into service by virtue of regulations under section 28—

Supplementary provisions relating to Merchant Navy Reserve.the provisions of the [1985 c. 17.] Reserve Forces (Safeguard of Employment) Act 1985 shall apply to that person as if any service rendered by him in pursuance of the call-out were whole-time service within the meaning of that Act; and

Supplementary provisions relating to Merchant Navy Reserve.any service so rendered shall be relevant service within the meaning of the [1951 c. 65.] Reserve and Auxiliary Forces (Protection of Civil Interests) Act 1951.
Safety of navigation, oil pollution etc.

leaf.margin: Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.

content.leaf: Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.If, having regard to the nature of the service for which it is intended—
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.a ship in a port in the United Kingdom, or
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.a ship registered in the United Kingdom which is in any other port,

Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.is, by reason of any of the matters mentioned in subsection (3), not fit to go to sea without serious danger to human life, then, subject to subsections (5) and (6), the master and the owner of the ship shall each be guilty of an offence.

Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.Where, at the time when a ship is not fit to go to sea as mentioned in subsection (1), any responsibilities of the owner with respect to the particular matters by reason of which the ship is not fit to go to sea have been assumed (whether wholly or in part) by any person or persons other than the owner, and have been so assumed by that person or (as the case may be) by each of those persons either—
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.directly, under the terms of a charter-party or management agreement made with the owner, or
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.indirectly, under the terms of a series of charter-parties or management agreements,

Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.the reference to the owner in subsection (1) shall be construed as including a reference to that other person or (as the case may be) to each of those other persons.
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.The matters referred to in subsection (1) are—
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.the condition, or the unsuitability for its purpose, of—
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.the ship or its machinery or equipment, or
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.any part of the ship or its machinery or equipment;
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.undermanning;
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.overloading or unsafe or improper loading;
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.any other matter relevant to the safety of the ship.
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.A person guilty of an offence under this section shall be liable—
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.on summary conviction, to a fine not exceeding £50,000;
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.on conviction on indictment, to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years or a fine, or both.
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.It shall be a defence in proceedings for an offence under this section to prove that at the time of the alleged offence—

Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.arrangements had been made which were appropriate to ensure that before the ship went to sea it was made fit to do so without serious danger to human life by reason of the matters falling within subsection (3) which are specified in the charge (or, in Scotland, which are libelled in the complaint, petition or indictment); or
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.it was reasonable for such arrangements not to have been made.
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.It shall also be a defence in proceedings for an offence under this section to prove—

Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.that, under the terms of one or more charter-parties or management agreements entered into by the defendant, the relevant responsibilities, namely—
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.where the defendant is the owner, his responsibilities with respect to the matters referred to in subsection (5) (a), or

Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.where the defendant is liable to proceedings under this section by virtue of subsection (2), so much of those responsibilities as had been assumed by him as mentioned in that subsection,
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.had at the time of the alleged offence been wholly assumed by some other person or persons party thereto; and

Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.that in all the circumstances of the case the defendant had taken such steps as it was reasonable for him to take, and exercised such diligence as it was reasonable for him to exercise, to secure the proper discharge of the relevant responsibilities during the period during which they had been assumed by some other person or persons as mentioned in paragraph (a);
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.and, in determining whether the defendant had done so, regard shall be had in particular to the matters mentioned in subsection (7).
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.Those matters are—

Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.whether prior to the time of the alleged offence the defendant was, or in all the circumstances ought reasonably to have been, aware of any deficiency in the discharge of the relevant responsibilities; and

Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.the extent to which the defendant was or was not able, under the terms of any such charter-party or management agreement as is mentioned in subsection (6)(a)—
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.to terminate it, or
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.to intervene in the management of the ship,
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.in the event of any such deficiency, and whether it was reasonable for the defendant to place himself in that position.
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.No proceedings for an offence under this section shall be instituted—
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.in England and Wales, except by or with the consent of the Secretary of State or the Director of Public Prosecutions;
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.in Northern Ireland, except by or with the consent of the Secretary of State or the Director of Public Prosecutions for Northern Ireland.
Owner and master liable in respect of dangerously unsafe ship.In this section—
